availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George E. Blackburn (Kenton County, KY, deputy clerk and corporal (USA))

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, deputy clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of C. J. Blackburn and Eleanor Blackburn. Resident in Kenton County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Kenton County in 1850. Deputy clerk of the Kenton Circuit Court in Kenton County in 1861. Corporal in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from October 8, 1862, to April 15, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 260A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 2 of microfilm.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 3, p. 23.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 270.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 100.
KYR-0001-020-1449.
